Metadata: Bight Bulletin/Boleti​n de la Cuenca (No. 6 and No. 7, Spring/Primaver​a and Fall/Otorio 2003)
University of California Sea Grant College Program, San Diego
Published quarterly in English and Spanish
Working together to protect the waters we share / Trabajando juntos para proteger las aguas que compartimos

The Bight Bulletin is a bilingual newsletter addressing water quality, coastal watersheds and habitats. The goal of the newsletter is to provide a mechanism for information exchange in the Southern California Bight for local, state and federal officials, educators, students, and non-​governmental organizations working towards reducing the impact of pollution and habitat loss on the coastal environment. Topics of interest: Triple Border Fence Project; Restoration of tidal wetlands at the Tijuana River National Estuarine Research Reserve; Terrestrial mammals of the coastal sage scrub vegetation of Baja California; The U.S. Commission on ocean policy; US-Mexico cooperative efforts in California halibut research; Sardine disease in California waters.
